summary:
HFMD is a common infection caused by viruses. It starts with a fever and makes you feel unwell. Then, you get spots or blisters on your hands, feet, mouth, and sometimes other areas. These symptoms usually show up 3-6 days after you're exposed. The rash goes away in about a week.

The virus spreads through close contact, coughing, or touching contaminated objects. Most people get better in 7-10 days without specific treatment. It's usually mild, but young children might need extra care if they get dehydrated. HFMD is common worldwide, often affecting kids under 5.
title: Hand, foot, and mouth disease
